com.zoe

Class Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zoe.Agent

  • public class Agent
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines an Agent, the core of the Zoe library. To create an Agent: - First, create an object of type this class (i.e. Agent) - Add resolvers (i.e., classes implementing Resolver) via the method addResolver(Resolver)) - Start the agent through start() in the main thread
    Since:
    25th October, 2017

      Default and only constructor In this constructor, both the RabbitMQClient and the Consumer are created.

             java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Default and only constructor In this constructor, both the RabbitMQClient and the Consumer are created.
        Parameters:

      • handler

        public void handler(java.lang.String consumerTag,
                    Envelope envelope,
                    AMQP.BasicProperties properties,
                    byte[] body)
             throws java.io.IOException
        This is the first method called by the Consumer.handleDelivery() method; it is originally declared to do nothing. The parameters of handleDelivery() are directly passed to this method. In case that something should be done before any delivery, this method should be overrided.
        Parameters:
        consumerTag -
        envelope -
        properties -
        body -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • addResolver

        public void addResolver(Resolver resolver)
        Adds a Resolver to the resolver list. Resolvers will be chosen by the API to resolve intents based on their name. This method is idempotent, i.e., already registered resolvers will not be added.
        Parameters:
        resolver - Resolver class that implements the intent solution

      • publish

        public void publish(JSONObject json)
        Publishes in the rabbitmq queue the parameter given.
        Parameters:
        json - Message to be delivered
